meanings.definition: The beliefs or practices of a padrone.
meanings.sent1: The padronisms of the old boss were deeply ingrained in the company culture.

meanings.sent3: The new employee found the padronisms of the office amusing, especially the rule about always wearing a tie.
meanings.sent4: His padronisms were like a roadmap for success, guiding everyone in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The padronisms of the wise leader were passed down through generations, shaping the future of the organization.

meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the padronisms of the old farmer, who always had a witty saying ready.
